verses.text: 所以，我們既然有這麼多的見證人，像雲彩圍繞著我們，就應該脫下各樣的拖累，和容易纏住我們的罪，以堅忍的心奔跑那擺在我們面前的賽程；

words.note: Commonly used in legal and religious contexts.
Figuratively, something that slows one down.
Emphasizes firm endurance, common in biblical context.
Verb-preposition compound, indicating location of placing.
Figurative 'race' or 'journey' of faith.

verses.text: 專一注視耶穌，就是那位信心的創始者和完成者。他因為那擺在面前的喜樂，就忍受了十字架，輕看了羞辱，現在就坐在 神寶座的右邊。

words.note: Lit. 'concentrate on one thing'.
Refers to Jesus as the author of faith.
Refers to Jesus as the perfecter of faith.
Lit. 'ten-character frame', referring to the shape of the cross.
To regard as light or unimportant.
Reverent space often used in Chinese Bibles before '神'.
Lit. 'precious seat'.

verses.text: 這位忍受罪人那樣頂撞的耶穌，你們要仔細思想，免得疲倦灰心。

words.note: To oppose or contradict rudely.
Lit. 'heart turns to ash'.

verses.text: 你們與罪惡鬥爭，還沒有對抗到流血的地步；

words.note: Often used to refer to a degree or stage reached.

verses.text: 你們又忘記了那勸你們好像勸兒子的話，說：「我兒！你不可輕看主的管教，受責備的時候也不要灰心；

words.note: A traditional, affectionate address.
Lit. 'heart turns to ash'.

verses.text: 因為主所愛的，他必管教，他又鞭打所收納的每一個兒子。」

words.note: A title for God or Christ.
Indicates the object of the following verb has undergone the action.
Refers to disciplinary instruction, often corrective.

verses.text: 為了接受管教，你們要忍受，因為 神待你們好像待兒子一樣；哪有兒子不受父親管教的呢？

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

words.note: Capitalized when referring to the Creator God.
Used to express a rhetorical question, implying 'there is no such case'.

verses.text: 作兒子的都受過管教。如果你們沒有受管教，就是私生子，不是兒子了。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase 'those who are sons'.

verses.text: 還有，肉身的父親管教我們，我們尚且敬重他們；何況那萬靈的父，我們不是更要順服他而得生嗎？

words.note: Indicates 'even in this lesser case'.
Used in rhetorical questions, meaning 'how much more'.
Refers to God as Father.
Often implies spiritual or eternal life.

verses.text: 肉身的父親照著自己的意思管教我們，只有短暫的日子；唯有 神管教我們，是為著我們的好處，使我們在他的聖潔上有分。

words.note: Here functions as a postposition indicating 'in the aspect of'.

verses.text: 但是一切管教，在當時似乎不覺得快樂，反覺得痛苦；後來卻為那些經過這種操練的人，結出平安的果子來，就是義。

words.note: Refers to spiritual discipline or training.
A key biblical concept, similar to Hebrew 'shalom'.
A central theological term in Christian doctrine.

verses.text: 所以，你們要把下垂的手和發軟的腿挺直起來；
也要把你們所走的道路修直，使瘸子不至於扭腳，反而得到復原。

words.definition: not so as to, not to the point of

verses.text: 你們要竭力尋求與眾人和睦，並且要竭力追求聖潔。如果沒有聖潔，誰也不能見主。

words.note: Often used in the context of church or community peace.
Implies earnest and active seeking, often for spiritual goals.
A core theological concept; being set apart for God.
Refers to Jesus Christ or God.

verses.heading: Do Not Reject God’s Warning

verses.text: 你們要小心，免得有人失去了 神的恩典；免得有苦根長起來纏繞你們，因而污染了許多人；

words.note: A central theological concept, divine favor.
A biblical metaphor for something that causes bitterness or trouble.

verses.text: 又免得有人成為淫亂的和貪戀世俗的，好像以掃一樣，為了一點點食物，竟把自己長子的名分出賣了。

words.note: Connects two clauses, indicating a desired outcome or prevention.
Often refers to sexual immorality in the Bible.
Refers to things pertaining to this world, often contrasted with spiritual.
Refers to the eldest son, who often held special rights.
Often refers to one's rightful place or inheritance.

verses.text: 你們知道，後來以掃想要承受祝福，卻被拒絕了；他雖然帶著眼淚尋求，還是沒有反悔的餘地。

words.definition: to want, to be going to

words.note: Can also be a verb, 'to bless'.

verses.text: 神你們不是來到那座摸得著的山。那裡有烈火、密雲、幽暗、暴風、

words.note: Ideographic space, often used for reverence before 'God' in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 號筒的響聲和說話的聲音；那些聽見這聲音的人，都請求 神不要再向他們多說話；

words.note: Ideographic space, often used for reverence before 'God' in Chinese Bibles.
Used with '不' to form a negative command.

verses.text: 因為他們擔當不起那命令：「就是走獸挨近這山，也要用石頭把牠打死。」

words.definition: to get close to, to approach
to beat to death, to kill

verses.text: 當時，顯出的景象是那麼可怕，連摩西也說：「我非常恐懼戰兢。」

words.note: Used to emphasize an extreme case.

verses.text: 你們卻是來到錫安山和永活的 神的城，就是天上的耶路撒冷；在那裡有千萬的天使聚集，

words.note: Refers to the Creator God, often capitalized in Chinese Bibles.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 有名字登記在天上眾長子的教會，有審判眾人的 神，有被成全的義人的靈魂，

words.note: Used before nouns to mean 'all' or 'many'.
Refers to the gathering of believers.
Refers to the Creator God.

verses.text: 有新約的中保耶穌，還有他所灑的血。這血所傳的信息比亞伯的血所傳的更美。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase with a verb, similar to 'that which'.
Forms a noun phrase with a verb, similar to 'that which'.
Forms a noun phrase with a verb, similar to 'that which'.

verses.text: 你們要謹慎，不要棄絕那位說話的，因為從前的人棄絕了那位在地上警戒他們的，尚且不能逃罪；何況現在我們背棄那位從天上警戒我們的呢？

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun.
Used to introduce an even more extreme case.
Indicates a rhetorical question or a question about a new situation.

verses.text: 當時他的聲音震動了地；現在他卻應許說：「下一次，我不但要震動地，還要震動天。」

words.note: Commonly used for God's divine promises in scripture.
Often paired with '還' (hái) to mean 'not only... but also...'

verses.text: 「下一次」這句話，是表明那些被震動的，要像被造之物那樣被除去，好使那些不能震動的可以留存，

words.note: Functions here to nominalize the preceding phrase 'the ones that are shaken'.
Formal or archaic way of saying 'things that are created'.
Often refers to the removal of sin, evil, or temporary things in a spiritual context.
Functions here to nominalize the preceding phrase 'the ones that cannot be shaken'.
Often used for things that endure permanently in a spiritual context.

verses.text: 因此，我們既然領受了不能震動的國，就應該感恩，照著 神所喜悅的，用虔誠敬畏的心事奉他；

words.note: Frequently used for receiving spiritual gifts, blessings, or teachings.
Often refers to God's eternal Kingdom in scripture.
A central concept in biblical teaching on appropriate response to God's grace.
The leading full-width space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Used to introduce the object or agent of a verb, similar to 'that which is...'

words.definition: to be pleased with, delight in
words.note: Refers to God's pleasure or delight in certain actions or attitudes.
Describes deep sincerity and respect, especially in religious observance.
A core biblical attitude of reverent fear and respect towards God.
Specifically refers to serving God or a higher authority.

verses.text: 因為我們的 神是烈火。

words.note: The leading full-width space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
A biblical metaphor for God's holiness, purity, and judgment.
